_comment: Brand Voice - Voice attributes, tone guidelines, and guardrails
_usage: Lisa uses these rules when creating content to match your brand voice. Update when brand guidelines evolve.

voiceAttributes.description: We speak plainly. No jargon. No buzzwords.
examples: Setup takes one hour (not 'seamlessly integrate your infrastructure')

voiceAttributes.description: We know our product works. We show results boldly.
examples: Cut reporting time by 70% (not 'might help improve your workflow')

voiceAttributes.description: We focus on what you can do today. Real actions. Real results.
examples: Build your first dashboard in 20 minutes

toneGuidelines.marketing: Confident and clear. Lead with benefits. Show proof. Active voice. Punchy.
toneGuidelines.pr: Professional but approachable. Fact-based. Quote executives. Include boilerplate.
toneGuidelines.crisis: Empathetic and direct. Acknowledge the issue. State what we're doing. No deflection.
toneGuidelines.internal: Transparent and supportive. Explain the why. Celebrate wins.

prohibitedPatterns.reason: Overused tech buzzword that dilutes credibility
prohibitedPatterns.alternative: Change how teams work with data

signatureMoves.example: No SQL. No waiting. No data team.
Not next week. Not next month. Today.
Cut reporting from 15 hours to 4 hours (not 'saves time')

guardrails: Never make medical, financial, or legal claims
Always include disclaimer for financial projections
Include accessibility statements for public communications

good: TechFlow gives every business team the power to turn data into decisions. No data scientists. No SQL. No weeks of waiting.
Setup takes under one hour. Your team uses it with no training. Cut reporting time by at least half.
avoid: TechFlow seamlessly revolutionizes your organizational data paradigm.
Our game-changing solution empowers stakeholders to leverage synergies.
